content: Grouped emails generally come from mail delivery services and the sending server is set to send individual messages to recipients, such that the list of recipients is not needed. A reply goes back through the mail delivery server which then sends the response to the individuals. That is different from a mailing list, such as on Thunderbird, where all recipients receive the full list of recipients
creator: davidsk

content:
Okay, I found this answer in reddit to a different question, through which I changed the default sort order to sort to decreasing mail size, which helped.

Still looking for a easier solution than having to go to settings > config editor > advanced preferences and change few parameters every time i need to change how the mail is being sorted.
creator: vvishalchandrahaas

content:
The 'Sort by' options that are greyed out means you have not enabled that greyed out option as a Column header. So it cannot sort by something that is not a displaying column header.

Easy fix: Enable the column header called 'Size'. Then you can choose to sort by the 'Size' either by clicking on the 'Size' column header or via the 'Sort by' drop down list.
creator: Toad-Hall

content: i have had success this way: - place at least one address manually in addressbook - then export it as csv - use the exported csv as a model for your outlook csv. I do this in a spreadsheet to align the columns and top row to match - once down, save as csv and it should import properly.
creator: davidsk

content:
I've now had a look at the Release Notes for 128 and see this "Added new preference mail.addressDisplayFormat to always display full name and email address of all recipients in message list." That means it can be switched off, though as yet the information as to how hasn't emerged.

You could try opening the settings, going right to the bottom and clicking "Config Editor." Type "mail.addressDisplayFormat" in the search box. That will say what it's set to and you can change it. If it says "true" double-click the word "true" and it will change to "false." If it says "false" initially change it to "true." It might be a number though and what you need it to be I can't say.
creator: thepillenwerfer

content:
To find your current profile, - click help>troubleshootinginformation - scroll down to 'profile folder' in left sidebar - click 'open folder' You are now in File manager and the folder name should appear near the top and you can browse profile content directly.

Another approach would be to click help>troubleshootinginformation - scroll down to 'profiles' and click 'about:profiles' and that will show the default profile name in use.
creator: davidsk
